Explanations about Options.-list:
Instead of writing the images, list the images along with various information for
 each image. Do not specify an image-root with this option.

Answers.MP Summary: list, test and extract compressed files in a ZIP archive

so_51449715: Extract range of lines using sed

Explanations about Options.-j:
junk paths. The archive's directory structure is not recreated; all files are
 deposited in the extraction directory (by default, the current one).
Explanations about Options.-c:
extract files to stdout/screen (``CRT''). This option is similar to the -p option
 except that the name of each file is printed as it is extracted, the -a option is
 allowed, and ASCII-EBCDIC conversion is automatically performed if appropriate.
 This option is not listed in the unzip usage screen.

Answers.MP Summary: Portable Document Format (PDF) to text converter (version 3.03)
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Convert filename.pdf to plain text and save it as filename.txt
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1195340: Extract a specific pdf from a zip file with lots of pdfs
so_34625953: Is there any way to get the page numbers in a PDF of a search pattern?
so_22416090: How to extract text from PDF according to its location?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_34625953: pdftotext test.pdf - |
awk -vRS=$'\f' -vNAME="My name" \
    'index($0,NAME){printf "%d: %s\n", NR, NAME;}'

pdftotext test.pdf - |
grep -F -o -e $'\f' -e 'My name' |
awk 'BEGIN{page=1} /\f/{++page;next} 1{printf "%d: %s\n", page, $0;}'

pdftotext test.pdf - |
awk -vRS=$'\f' \
    '/My[[:space:]]+Name/{printf "%d: %s\n", NR, "My Name";}'
